sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: Cjdns implements an encrypted IPv6 network using public-key cryptography for address allocation and a distributed hash table for routing. This provides near-zero-configuration networking, and prevents many of the security and scalability issues that plague existing networks.

sections.title: Installation
sections.content: Install cjdns. An alternative cjdns-gitAUR package (with more dependencies) is also available.

sections.title: Configuration
sections.content:
On installation, a /etc/cjdroute.conf is autogenerated.

If you need to re-generate it, execute:

```
# cjdroute --genconf > /etc/cjdroute.conf
```

Edit /etc/cjdroute.conf as root to add at least one peer to the connectTo section. Peers can be anyone else running cjdns who gives you credentials to connect to them with. They can be found in Hyperboria peers, #cjdns and #projectmeshnet on EFnet among many other places.

sections.title: Starting
sections.content:
Start/enable the cjdns.service.

If cjdns did not start, you should check the unit status or use journalctl and edit /etc/cjdroute.conf if needed.
